intro: Kosteletzkya virginica, commonly known as sea oxeye, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of the United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its yellow flowers and palmate leaves. The plant thrives in salty, brackish, or freshwater environments, often found in marshes and along shorelines. Its structure includes a stout, succulent stem that can grow up to several feet tall. Kosteletzkya virginica plays an important ecological role by stabilizing sediments and providing habitat for various wildlife species.
